Single-Entry Endorsement Extension for Hong Kong | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

You’re asking whether, as a Chinese citizen living in Guangzhou’s Huangpu District, you can go to the exit‑entry administration office to extend a single‑entry endorsement on your Two‑Way Permit (“Exit‑Entry Permit for Travelling to and from Hong Kong and Macao”) and then use a machine to help you activate it so you can travel to Hong Kong for seven days. Let’s clear this up step by step:

1. Can you get a one-time (single-entry) endorsement extended?

Yes, Mainland Chinese citizens residing in Guangzhou (Huangpu) apply to the local Exit‑Entry Administration of the Public Security Bureau to obtain or extend entry endorsements on their Two‑Way Permit. Endorsements include single‑, double‑, and multiple‑entry options, with types such as:

  • G endorsement (individual tourism): Valid for 3 months or 1 year, single or double‑journey, with each visit up to 7 days (Wikipedia).

So yes, you can go to the administration office to apply for a single‑entry G endorsement if your permit’s current endorsements are insufficient.

2. Once you have the endorsement, can you stay in Hong Kong for 7 days?

Yes. The G endorsement you receive allows a maximum stay of 7 days per visit. That means with a valid single‑entry G endorsement, you may stay in Hong Kong for up to 7 days (Wikipedia).

3. Can you use a machine (self-service kiosk) to get the endorsement instantly?

Yes! In many provinces, including Guangdong, there are automatic endorsement machines installed at Exit‑Entry Administration offices. These allow holders of the Two‑Way Permit to obtain exit endorsements (like G, S, T) by themselves — typically scanning the permit, paying a fee, and receiving the endorsement on the spot (Wikipedia).

This streamlines the process—no need to wait in longer lines.

4. Does this match what you remember about Shenzhen’s policy?

Similar measures have been introduced specifically in Shenzhen:

  • Residents (including non‑permanent ones with residence permits) can obtain multiple‑entry permits valid for one year, allowing unlimited visits—each up to 7 days. A self‑service machine (kiosk) can be used for this in under two minutes, with QR code payment (Shenzhen Government).

While that policy is specific to Shenzhen, Guangzhou offers a similar automatic endorsement service more broadly under the national system.

Summary of What’s Possible (Yes):

  • You can go to your local Exit-Entry administration office in Huangpu to extend or get a single-entry G endorsement on your Two-Way Permit.
  • The G endorsement entitles you to a 7-day stay in Hong Kong.
  • Self-service machines are indeed available in many offices—including in Guangdong—to process endorsements quickly and conveniently.

Tips for Your Visit:

  • Bring your Two-Way Permit (with at least 3 months’ validity remaining).
  • Visit the local Exit-Entry Administration bureau (PSB).
  • Look for the endorsement machine/self-service kiosk.
  • Select the G endorsement (single entry), scan your card, pay the fee, and receive it immediately.
  • Now you can travel to Hong Kong and stay up to 7 days.
